ygData.subject: RE: Chain vs. snare
ygData.msgSnippet: ... aye, stubborn indeeed. =P ... i would love to concentrate on pixie/charm/anthem during battle instead of worrying about who to chain, which mobs are about
ygData.messageBody:
>LOL no it doesn't start with a J. but you seemed to want
>an opinion from someone higher from how i read it, and you
>just seem stubborn =P

aye, stubborn indeeed. =P

>so what i am trying to get across is that i felt exactly the
>same as you. hopefully you will see there is another perspective,
>and maybe it is better and you will learn more you encounter it
>more often. i think that's all we are trying to say.

i would love to concentrate on pixie/charm/anthem during battle
instead of worrying about who to chain, which mobs are about to
run and just leave it all to the druid/ranger. I have had too
many bad experiences I suppose with people not doing snares.

the comment that amounted to: If you dont play nice, no one
will group with you... was uncalled for. I'm more or less
irritated at that more than whos job it is to snare. I never
have any runners, so my groups never had any problems. I always
find groups who need me =) (in response to the post earlier)

Harmonic Distortion, 30th drummer.
League of Antonican Bards, The Wind Spirit's Song
< Keepers of Norrath > Innoruuk
